title: Why is RIOT enforcing the "Best Botlane Win" Meta so hard?
body:
Normaly when RIOT is so dead bound to keep one role dominating, its because of awesome LCS plays, but in that case it doesnt make any sense, because the ADC domination is very boring to watch, has no flashy plays at all and is overally super dull... 

Nothing is exiting in watching an ADC just autoattacking the enemy team, melting squishys and tanks away and the whole game is decided on which ADC can melt the frontline faster... 

So its not for LCS, so WHY? Why do they refuse to balance bot lane?

I play primarily ADC/JG/Support. Learning mid in ranked.

I've just spent some time checking top 200 players in EUW and KR. Number one by role are jungler mains, second come AD mains, third support players, fourth top players and last come midlaners by numbers. Being last by players in top tier for a role says it obviously has the least impact, which when combined with the fact that midlane is the most played role - on theory should have the most players in top tier (the more a role is played if they are equal important, the more challengers will be from this role) means it's the most underpowered role with insufficent impact on the game.

The balance of a role should be measured by highest tier players only due to them as possible as close to the potential of a champion/role.

League was built around the following:

* Attack Damage Carries being the core of your team, they deal the damage, in great numbers

* Tanks use their sheer mass and/or Crowd Control to prevent the carry from dying before the enemy

* Burst Mages and Assassins pick off non-tanky supports or even the enemy carry

* Artillery Mages provide pressure and peel during a fight, sometimes scoring a kill or two.

* Enchanters empower or protect the one who needs it most, typically the carry.

* Bruisers and Fighters peel for the carry and absorb some blows, typically forcing the enemy to reposition *Editted for clarity:* Take this line with a grain of salt, since my knowledge with these subclasses is very minimal.

All of your team plays a role in the assistance of your carry. This is how league was built. Carries arent meant to be flashy, they are meant to deal consistent damage, sacrificing movement and bulk, and relying on positioning.

*Another edit for clarity:* Not gonna disagree that many carries right now are too strong. Because they are.

Point is, in earlier season you could carry as a non ADC Champion. 
Now thats nearly impossible.
It's was a very unhealthy time, since Assassins and Mages would tear through teams. There is a reason "ADC in 2017" was born.

He was wrong about fighters being peelers (lol), but you're wrong about fighters being carries.

It is worth noting that Juggernauts were designed to be tanky top lane carries that a team could be built around such as intentionally picking high CC jungle or a MS boosting Support like Lulu. I think saying fighters aren't carries is not wholly true even if for awhile it has felt like you couldn't be one.

The characters you mentioned, like fiora and riven, are skirmishers. A Skirmisher is a high damage high mobility character with one defenseive steroid. They are meant to force a 1v1 prior to a teamfight to efficiently take down the enemy. While a skirmisher _can_ carry, they need to be very fed, even then a well-timed Hard Crowd Control will shut them down on the spot. Yes, anyone "can" carry. But the point of the game is to assist the Marksman of bottom lane, whether it be picking, peel, tank, or buffs.
